definition[0]: a piece of equipment on an aircraft that records what happens on a flight and can be used to discover the cause of accidents
definition[1]: an electronic unit that records information on an aircraft about its height, speed etc. If the plane crashes, the black box can be examined to find the causes
example[0]: Data from the black box recovered from the destroyed helicopter has been played back satisfactorily.
definition[2]: a machine that works in a secret way that is not normally explained to people
example[1]: We found out what formulas were inside the black boxes that firms used to determine when to set off computer-driven program trades.
